page.title: 01EYDON - A VILLAGE
page.content: Eydon is built on an inusual box shape - with four roads or lanes enclosing a central block containing most of the older properties. It is on a ridge with a high water table and away from main roads. Access can be difficult in Winter. Farmland surrounds the village and the main farmhouses are to be found in the village itself with the land stretching away behind them. Most people work in industry in the nearby towns, there being very little employment in Eydon itself, the farms being worked by their owners. there is a good general shop, post office, public house, church and chapel, village hall, several visiting butchers, bakers and a fishman. Also a good bus service to Banbury. Eydon is rapidly becoming a dormitory as the old people die the young people move away, not being able to compete with
